âœ¨ yatto | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Managing to-do lists with version control and collaboration features in a terminal environment.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ TUI-based interface â€¢ Local file storage (JSON) â€¢ VCS integration (Git/Jujutsu) â€¢ Project-based task organization â€¢ Task attributes (due dates, labels)
ðŸ“– Summary: Yatto is a terminal-based to-do application that leverages Bubble Tea for its TUI. It stores tasks as individual JSON files and uses Git or Jujutsu for version control, enabling collaboration, synchronization, and backup of tasks.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ codon | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Accelerating Python code execution for computationally intensive tasks, particularly those benefiting from multithreading and numerical computation.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ High-performance Python compilation â€¢ Native machine code generation â€¢ 10-100x speedups over CPython â€¢ Native multithreading support (no GIL) â€¢ Interoperability with Python ecosystem
ðŸ“– Summary: Codon is a high-performance Python compiler that translates Python code into native machine code, achieving significant speedups (10-100x or more) compared to standard CPython. It supports native multithreading and aims to provide performance comparable to C/C++ while maintaining a syntax and semantics close to CPython.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ Steve | Java
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automating tasks within Minecraft using AI agents controlled by natural language commands.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Natural language instruction processing for task execution â€¢ Autonomous resource extraction, building, combat, and exploration â€¢ Multi-agent coordination for parallel task execution and conflict resolution â€¢ Integration with LLMs (Groq, OpenAI, Gemini) for reasoning and planning
ðŸ“– Summary: The Steve repository provides a Minecraft mod that introduces AI agents, embodied as 'Steves,' into the game. These agents can perform tasks autonomously based on natural language instructions, such as mining resources, building structures, and coordinating with other agents to complete complex projects.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ DllShimmer | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Pentesting and red teaming to gain initial access and persistence on Windows systems by backdooring DLLs.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ DLL hijacking â€¢ Backdooring DLL functions â€¢ Generating C++ boilerplate code for function injection â€¢ Creating .def files to maintain original DLL exports â€¢ Static and dynamic linking options
ðŸ“– Summary: DllShimmer is a Go-based tool for weaponizing DLL hijacking. It allows users to backdoor functions within DLLs without disrupting normal process operation by generating proxy DLLs with identical exports to the original, enabling the injection of custom code into those functions.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ stormy | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Displaying weather information in a terminal with a customizable and visually appealing interface.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Multiple weather providers (OpenMeteo, OpenWeatherMap) â€¢ Current weather conditions with ASCII art â€¢ Temperature, wind, humidity, and precipitation information â€¢ Customizable units (metric, imperial, standard)
ðŸ“– Summary: Stormy is a minimal, customizable, and neofetch-like weather CLI written in Go. It provides current weather conditions, temperature, wind, humidity, and precipitation information using multiple weather providers like OpenMeteo and OpenWeatherMap. It supports customizable units, a local configuration file, color support, and a compact display mode.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ dnSurfer | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Browsing text-based web content in environments where HTTP/HTTPS is blocked, such as captive portals.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ DNS Browser (Desktop/Electron) â€¢ Custom DNS Server (Node.js) â€¢ Text-only web content retrieval over DNS TXT records â€¢ Bypassing HTTP/HTTPS restrictions
ðŸ“– Summary: dnSurfer is a proof-of-concept web browser that operates entirely over the DNS protocol. It includes a desktop client built with Electron and a custom DNS server built with Node.js, allowing users to fetch text-only web content by translating DNS queries into web page data, bypassing traditional HTTP/HTTPS protocols.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
